sport may create more transport emissions if there is an overall modal shift out of transit
Similarly, some work suggests that commercial shared vehicle services such as Uber
leading to increased vehicle kms travelled

(Akyelken et al. 2018; Jittrapirom et al. 2018; Pangbourne et al. 2020; Marsden 2018)
In the context of the transport sector, digitalisation has enabled teleworking, which in
turn reduces travel demand. On the other hand, the prevalence of online shopping, enabled by the digital
economy, could have mixed effects on transport emissions
travelled but the move to expedited or rush delivery could mitigate some
benefits as they prevent consolidation of freight
Digitalisation could also lead to systemic changes by enabling smart mobility. The smart mobility
paradigm refers to the process and practic
es of assimilation of ICTs and other sophisticated hi

IOT, Big Data) and shared economy could overcome some of the challenges facing the adoption of
